snippet: A law intended to prohibit the payment of bribes to foreign officials by United States businesses has produced more than $3 billion in settlements. But the list of companies making settlements is notable for its lack of American names.
abstract: A law intended to prohibit the payment of bribes to foreign officials by United States businesses has produced more than $3 billion in settlements. But the list of companies making settlements is notable for its lack of American names.

headline.main: Foreign Firms Most Affected by a U.S. Law Barring Bribes
